contentrichtext.text: {{Greek myth (personified)}} In [[Greek mythology]], '''Bia''' was the [[personification]] of force, daughter of [[Pallas (son of Crius)|Pallas]] and [[Styx (mythology)|Styx]], and sister of [[Nike (mythology)|Nike]], [[Kratos (mythology)|Kratos]], and [[Zelus]].<ref>[[Hesiod]], ''[[Theogony]]'' 383–5.</ref> She and her siblings were constant companions of [[Zeus]].<ref>[[Hesiod]], ''[[Theogony]]'' 386–7.</ref> They achieved this honour after supporting Zeus in the war of the [[Titan (mythology)|Titans]] along with their mother.<ref>[[Hesiod]], ''[[Theogony]]'' 389–94.</ref> Bia is one of the characters named in the Greek tragedy ''[[Prometheus Bound]]'', written by [[Aeschylus]], where [[Hephaestus]] is compelled by the gods to bind [[Prometheus]] after he was caught stealing fire and offering the gift to mortals. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.theoi.com/Daimon/Bia.html Theoi Mythology, Bia] {{DEFAULTSORT:Bia (Mythology)}} [[Category:Greek goddesses]] [[Category:War goddesses]] [[Category:Personification in Greek mythology]] {{Greek mythology (deities)}} {{Greek-deity-stub}}
